Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday January 16), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing'

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, january 16th.

first up, microsoft is in the headlines today as the tech giant announced a significant update to its partnership with openai. microsoft plans to invest an additional $10 billion into the artificial intelligence research lab over the next five years. the company aims to enhance its azure cloud services with openai's advanced ai models, further pushing its capabilities in areas like natural language processing and machine learning. this move could be a game-changer in the ai infrastructure domain, positioning microsoft as a leader in ai development.

meanwhile, in the social media realm, facebook parent company meta is facing fresh scrutiny from eu regulators. the european union has raised concerns about meta's handling of user data, especially around targeted advertising practices. the company could be facing fines if it doesn't comply with new eu data protection rules. meta has responded by stating its commitment to privacy and readiness to work with regulators.

in streaming news, netflix shares are on a slight rise today following the release of its latest earnings report. the streaming giant added 4 million new subscribers over the last quarter, exceeding wall street expectations. the company credits this growth to its release of several hit shows and movies, signaling that its investment in original content continues to pay off.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, january 16th.

first in the headlines, microsoft is making waves with a major announcement regarding its partnership with openai. the tech giant revealed plans to invest another $10 billion into the ai research lab over the next five years. the strategic move aims to bolster microsoft's azure cloud services with openai's cutting-edge ai models, enhancing capabilities in natural language processing and machine learning. this substantial investment positions microsoft as a formidable player in the ai infrastructure space.

turning to social media, meta, facebook's parent company, is under fresh scrutiny from eu regulators. the european union has voiced concerns over meta's handling of user data, particularly in relation to targeted advertising practices. meta may face fines if it fails to align with the new eu data protection rules. in response, the company has reaffirmed its commitment to privacy and expressed its willingness to collaborate with regulators.

in streaming news, netflix shares are trending upwards following the release of its latest earnings report. the streaming giant reported a gain of 4 million new subscribers in the last quarter, surpassing wall street's expectations. netflix attributes this growth to its strategic investment in original content, marked by the release of several hit shows and movies, demonstrating that these efforts continue to be fruitful.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-455 Microsoft's $10b Ai Partnership with Openai 🤝, Meta's Regulatory Challenge in the Eu 🛡️, Netflix's Subscriber Surge 📈
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, january 16th. dive into today's top tech stories:

  • microsoft’s $10 billion ai investment: microsoft plans to invest in openai to enhance azure cloud services with advanced ai capabilities, focusing on natural language processing and machine learning.
  • meta under eu scrutiny: eu regulators examine meta's user data handling and targeted advertising practices, with potential fines looming if they fail to comply with data protection rules.
  • netflix subscriber surge: netflix reports a gain of 4 million new subscribers, attributing growth to successful investments in original content, surpassing wall street expectations.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
